abstract: A squirrel causes Phillies pitcher Roy Oswalt problems in St. Louis, and scheduling makes watching the Arizona-Milwaukee series a challenge.
snippet: A squirrel causes Phillies pitcher Roy Oswalt problems in St. Louis, and scheduling makes watching the Arizona-Milwaukee series a challenge.
lead_paragraph: All through the baseball playoffs, Mike Tanier will provide the Bats blog with daily updates on less-than-important developments from around the league. He vows to keep Phillies homerism to a minimum.La Russa's Acorn-Hoarding Minions. Busch Stadium has been overrun by squirrels in the last two days. On Tuesday night, a critter scurried across the field and ran around in foul territory. His reasoning: "I'm cute. I have a fluffy tail. I am totally going to get picked up by a ball girl!" On Wednesday, either the same squirrel or an accomplice dashed right in front of the plate as Roy Oswalt delivered a pitch. Umpire Angel Hernandez called it a ball, and Oswalt complained that he was distracted by the squirrel. Hernandez was probably the distracted one, as the pitch clearly caught the inside corner.

headline.main: In the Playoffs, Spirited Squirrels and Bad Time Slots
